description: See how George Washington compares to more than 2,000 American colleges.
title: Economic diversity and student outcomes at George Washington
title_page: Economic diversity and student outcomes at George Washington - The New York Times
text:
Washington, District of Columbia
The median family income of a student from George Washington is $182,200, and 70% come from the top 20 percent. About 2.2% of students at George Washington came from a poor family but became a rich adult.
A new study, based on millions of anonymous tax records, shows that some colleges are even more economically segregated than previously understood, while others are associated with income mobility.
Below, estimates of how George Washington compares with its peer schools in economic diversity and student outcomes.
